image.altText: An aerial view of aqua blue water lapping along rocks with green scrub in the distance.

props.synopsis: A traditional owner has succeeded in his bid to stop energy giant Santos from starting work on an underwater pipeline near the Tiwi Islands — but work on another section has been allowed to resume.

title.children: Federal Court blocks part of Santos' multi-billion-dollar pipeline in latest setback against Barossa project

image.altText: A sign that reads "Old Timers Village".

props.synopsis: Twenty-four residents and four staff at the Old Timers Village in Alice Springs have returned positive tests.

title.children: NT aged care facility in lockdown as one third of residents test positive for COVID-19

image.altText: A satellite photo showing the Al-Shifa hospital complex in Gaza, surrounded by suburban rooftops

props.synopsis: The Israeli military launches a "precise and targeted operation" inside Gaza's Al-Shifa Hospital.

title.children: WHO loses contact with Al-Shifa doctors as Israeli military forces raid hospital — as it happened

image.altText: A an old colour photo of a boys soccer team with a male coach. The boys' faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: After Victorian teacher David Ernest Keith MacGregor was convicted of indecent assault, the education department transferred him to a new school.

title.children: Victoria's education department organised internal transfer for paedophile teacher, inquiry hears

image.altText: Tyler Whitton's family wear shirts with his name on the front

props.synopsis: Tyler Whitton was still legally a child when he went to work at a Brisbane construction site for the final time.

title.children: 'Bring his blood from the concrete': Family of 17-year-old apprentice killed in workplace accident speak out

image.altText: Troye Sivan accepts an ARIA Award for Song of the Year.

props.synopsis: Australian music's night of nights is here, the 2023 ARIA Awards. Here's the full list of winners in all categories.

title.children: ARIA Awards 2023: Troye Sivan takes home four awards, tearful G Flip wins two — Here's the full list of winners

image.altText: Two women at a red carpet event

props.synopsis: Celebrities have walked the red carpet before the 2023 ARIA Awards kick off at Sydney's Hordern Pavilion. Here's a look at some of the outfits we've seen.

title.children: ARIA awards red carpet: Bright colours, sleek suits, and a nod to Rihanna's Met Gala outfit

image.altText: an aboriginal woman wearing headphones

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal woman's fight for financial freedom has revealed what experts say is a deeper problem of "culturally biased" cognitive exams, as part of the NT's Public Guardian and Trustee system.

title.children: Before Tracey had her guardianship order revoked, she was asked to name the US president

image.altText: Virat Kohli leaps into the air.

props.synopsis: Heartbreak and history combine in Mumbai as New Zealand's dreams are once again crushed deep in a World Cup at the hands of India stars Virat Kohli and Mohammed Shami.

title.children: Kohli makes cricket history as he and Shami shatter New Zealand's World Cup dream

image.altText: Soccer player Nestory Irankunda with father Gideon at Hindmarsh Stadium.

props.synopsis: Nestory Irankunda is still a teenager but has the soccer world at his feet, his skills set to be let loose on the international stage after his signing with German giant Bayern Munich.

title.children: Nestory Irankunda's signing with Bayern Munich is a 'watershed moment' for Australian soccer

image.altText: A man with brown short hair and a beard stands in front of a deep fryer wearing a chef's apron.

props.synopsis: Victorian man Jonathon Edwards will serve just 20 months in prison after pleading guilty to possessing more than 6,300 files containing images of child sexual abuse and torture.

title.children: Chef's plan to lure a woman to Australia to have a baby they could sexually abuse, deemed 'abhorrent' by judge

image.altText: A picture of a stone grave with a plaque missing.

props.synopsis: Police allege the plaques were taken from gravestones at Sunshine Coast cemeteries in early November and sold to second-hand metal dealers with the names removed.

title.children: Two men accused of stealing brass plaques from graves and selling metal

image.altText: Two power transmission towers in the middle on an open field with a sunrise in the background.,

props.synopsis: A scorching hot summer could see demand for electricity spike to a once-in-a-decade high, we're being warned, increasing the risk of blackouts, and forced power outages across the country.

title.children: Bushfires and heatwaves set to drive 'extreme' demand for power, increasing risk of blackouts

image.altText: Firefighting crews battle a large foiefront in bushland near Lightning Ridge.

props.synopsis: An emergency warning has been downgraded for the Hudson bushfire burning in the Narran Lake Reserve in north-west New South Wales, but authorities are bracing for similar conditions on Thursday.

title.children: Hudson bushfire in north-west NSW downgraded but similar conditions expected on Thursday

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a blue air force uniform looks grim in front of the side doors to Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The senior Air Force officer recently appointed as the National Cyber Security Coordinator has been recalled to Defence to deal with what the department describes as a "workplace matter".

title.children: Defence recalls cybersecurity coordinator Air Marshal Darren Goldie

image.altText: A row of NSW police shoulder patches are seen as officers stand in a line.

props.synopsis: A senior NSW detective is charged with drink driving following an investigation into a crash earlier this year.

title.children: NSW Police reject 'cover-up' after detective charged with drink driving months after crash

image.altText: A waitress in a white shirt carries a tray of glasses in a Canberra restaurant.

props.synopsis: Wages post their biggest quarterly increase in at least a quarter of a century, due to big pay boosts for aged care staff and workers on awards.

title.children: Despite the biggest wages rise on record, the real pay of Australian workers is stuck near a 13-year low

image.altText: Immigration generic by Emma Machan

props.synopsis: Some of the detainees released from immigration detention were sent into the community without visas, a revelation that appears to contradict what the federal government has said in recent days.

title.children: Detainees released without visas after High Court decision in immigration revelation

image.altText: A group of women and children on the back of a van

props.synopsis: As a humanitarian disaster unfolds in Gaza, the United States fears a power vacuum will soon follow. But Palestinian leaders say the current ideas for post-war Gaza aren't viable.

title.children: America has an idea for what post-war Gaza could look like. Here's why almost everyone is against it

image.altText: The Riverlea housing project at Buckland Park in Adelaide's north.

props.synopsis: On the one hand, is a $3 billion development to accommodate thousands of families. On the other, is a burial site that is of immeasurable cultural significance. The problem? They are both on the same ground.

title.children: It looks like an oasis, but the Riverlea development has been harbouring a secret

image.altText: Troye Sivan smiles as he stands from his seat as people around him celebrate at an awards night

props.synopsis: An increasingly speechless Troye Sivan scoops best solo artist and song of the year on Australian music's night of nights in Sydney.

title.children: Troye Sivan cleans up at the ARIAs with four awards, Genesis Owusu wins Album of the Year — as it happened

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: More Australians are reporting being targeted by cybercriminals, as the nation's digital spy agency points the finger at China as the major backer of serious hacking of Australian companies and critical infrastructure.

title.children: China blamed as major backer behind hacking of Australian companies and infrastructure

image.altText: A man sits outside Parliament House with a dog and a sign that says 'Day 14 Climate Hunger Strike'.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, Gregory Andrews was the high commissioner to West Africa, where he was responsible for promoting Australia's mining interests. Today, he is on the lawns of Parliament House, 14 days into a hunger strike protesting the lack of government action on climate change.

title.children: Gregory Andrews used to be a senior Liberal adviser. Now he's 14 days into a climate action hunger strike

image.altText: A wooden pillar is deteriorating below a bridge

props.synopsis: Harvey community members are concerned that the sudden closure of Forestry Road bridge for urgent repairs could cut the town off from supply trucks and emergency vehicles.

title.children: 'Catastrophic' risk closes bridge, with locals and vital services facing lengthy detours

image.altText: aerial view of a car crossing a bridge in an outback setting

props.synopsis: The Queensland Audit Office reports that the state's councils over the past five years have found assets such as vast stretches of road, lost due to administrative blunders.

title.children: Council finds $32m worth of footpaths, pipes and other assets it didn't realise it owned

image.altText: A woman with her head in her hands.

props.synopsis: Relatives of two teenagers who were taken to hospital after self-harming at the notorious Unit 18 over the weekend slam the government's claim the facility is safe. WARNING: This story discusses incidents of self-harm and contains the image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Boy who self-harmed in youth custody claims he was treated ‘like an animal’ as family speaks out

image.altText: A drone photo of a Tiger shark.

props.synopsis: More Surf Life Saving volunteers will be trained up to operate shark-spotting drones over patrol popular beaches this summer, to help protect swimmers after recent attacks.

title.children: Drone surveillance to be ramped up after two shark attacks in regional SA

image.altText: A woman with silver hair in a purple shirt standing in a garden in front of metal scraps used for sculptures.

props.synopsis: Jo Caminiti spent years in pain and being so tired she could barely walk as doctors failed to link her symptoms to perimenopause. She says a simple treatment "transformed" her life overnight.

title.children: When Jo felt her life was 'falling apart', doctors had no answers. Then she saw a news show and diagnosed herself

image.altText: A large number of naked people standing in waist deep water, photographed from behind, looking at hills beyond

props.synopsis: Spencer Tunick has photographed thousands of naked people all over the world, from Barcelona to Bondi. In November, it's Brisbane's turn.

title.children: Wear no underwear and listen to the megaphone: What to do at the Spencer Tunick shoot in Brisbane
